author: Julie Verhage
title: Bank of America: Here's What you Should Own This Earnings Season
text:
In case you forgot amidst the crisis in Greece and the rollercoaster ride that is Chinese stocks , earnings season is about to begin in the U.S.
Last quarter the big stories were earnings declines in the energy sector thanks to falling oil prices and large international companies facing forex headwinds as the U.S. dollar strengthened against other currencies. During this past quarter, however, oil prices and the dollar have been fairly stable, meaning analysts' earnings per share estimates (EPS) may have hit bottom and it's more likely that earnings come in above analysts' estimates, at least according to Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
In new research from Savita Subramanian, BofAML strategist, the worst of the cuts to earnings estimates is likely behind us.
In her note, she says that estimates for the second quarter have fallen by just two percent since April, or just half the amount she typically sees. Here are two charts highlighting her points:
The first one shows that the aggregate EPS estimate for all the companies in the S&P 500 seems to have stabilized since late April.
The second chart underscores the trend in earnings estimates in the three months leading up to earnings season. As you can see, there is a huge difference in the revisions for the first quarter of this year and the second quarter.
So, with that in mind, which sectors should you own? Here are Subramanian's recommendations:
Each quarter we have ranked sectors by these measures, and for 2Q15 earnings season we found that that healthcare screens as most attractive, while materials screens as least attractive.
Healthcare has now screened as the most attractive sector the last three quarters, and has continued to surprise to the upside.
